results.title: Changing the needle
results.creator_credit: Martha Ansara, Dasha Ross, Mavis Robertson and Jequerity
results.brief_description: One of the consequences of the Vietnam war is a quarter million Vietnamese drug addicts. This film shot in Vietnam in 1981 shows how an underdeveloped war ravaged country is dealing with this problem. Alternative medicine such as acupuncture, natural medicines and exercises play an important part in the rehabilitation process. It also shows a society trying to cope with material scarcity and poverty - the heritage of underdevelopment and the inevitable result of war. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Changing schools: 1912-1985
results.creator_credit: Penny Robins and Penny Robins Video Projects
results.brief_description: Using archival footage this video raises a variety of issues relevant to contemporary educational debate in both Victoria and Australia at large. Topics addressed include the need for education to change, the role of government schools, equal educational opportunity, the integration of disabled children, Aboriginal education, multiculturalism and parent participation.

results.title: Changing our minds: the story of Dr. Evelyn Hooker
results.creator_credit: Richard Schmiechen, David Haugland and Intrepid Productions
results.brief_description: This fascinating documentary is a biography of Dr. Evelyn Hooker, whose research into the psychological profile of homosexual men was instrumental in the eventual declassification of homosexuality as a mental illness. Prior to Hooker’s research homosexuals and lesbians endured a range of psychiatric treatment including lobotomies, aversion therapy and hormone injections to treat their “disease”. Hooker began her research in 1954, with encouragement from a gay colleague who convinced her that psychiatric definitions of sexuality had been under-researched. Over the next fifteen years her research convinced her that psychologically it was impossible to distinguish between heterosexual and homosexual profiles. In 1974, Hooker and other progressive psychologists - in tandem with lesbian and gay activists - succesfully petitioned the American Psychiatric Association to drop its definition of homosexuality as a pathological mental illness. This moving biography includes interviews with Hooker and archival documentation of the “underground” lesbian and homosexual communities in America during the 1950s and 1960s. “Changing Our Minds” was nominated for an Academy Award in 1993 for Best Feature Documentary. Narrated by Patrick Stewart.

results.title: Changing of the guard = Zmiana warty
results.brief_description: An animated fairy tale in which all of the characters - the soldier of the Royal Guard, the King’s daughter whom he loves, and all the King’s subjects are matchboxes which go up in flames because they have not learned the dangers of playing with fire.

results.title: Changing horizons
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Bushwalking in Australia means leaving the beaten tracks and venturing into the wild, rugged mountain country, with little more than the pursuit of adventure as the motive, and good healthy exercise and the companionship of fellow walkers, the rewards. The film includes scenes of Lamington National Park, Queensland, the upper reaches of the Yarra in Victoria’s Warburton Ranges, and the Blue Mountains in New South Wales.
